4885.74 4501.64 1975 4875.36 4657.75 1976 5136.91 4819.27 1977 5373.06 4986.39 1978 5672.78 5159.3 1979 5850.05 5338.21 1980 5834 5523.33 1981 5982.08 5714.86 1982 5865.93 5913.04 1983 6130.93 6118.08 1984 6571.5 6330.24 1985 6843.42 6549.76 1986 7080.46 6776.88 1987 7307.04 7011.89 1988 7607.39 7255.04 1989 7879.2 7506.63 1990 8027.05 7766.94 1991 8008.3 8036.27 1992 8280 8314.95 1993 8516.18 8603.29 1994 8863.1 8901.63 1995 9085.96 9210.31 1996 9425.84 9529.7 1997 9845.92 9860.16 1998 10274.74 10202.08 1999 10770.65 10555.86 2000 11216.4 10921.91 2001 11337.47 11300.66 2002 11543.12 11692.53 2003 11836.43 12098 2004 12246.93 12517.52 2005 12622.96 12951.59 2006 12958.49 13400.72 2007 13206.37 13865.42 2008 13161.94 14346.24 2009 12703.12 14843.72 2010 13087.98 15358.46 2011 13313.43 15891.05 Note: Vertical shading represents NBER recession dates (approximately 1902 through 1904, 1907 though 1908, 1910 through 1912, 1913 through 1914, 1918 through 1919, 1920 though 1921, 1923 through 1924, 1926 tough 1927, 1929 though 1933, 1937 though 1938, 1945, 1948 though 1949, 1953 though 1954, 1957 though 1958, 1960 through 1961, 1969 though 1970, 1973 though 1975, 1980, 1981 though 1982, 1990 though 1991, 2001, and 2007 though 2009). Dashed line denotes trend (column 3 in table). Source: For 1900-1926, Historical Statistics of the United States: Millenial
